column4: ahh ok thx
is there a way to step up anti-aliasing <ATI> for full screen video without catalyst?
Have you installed the restricted drivers? Otherwise, you could install the proprietary ones from ATI........
yes I've installed those
which ones?
ATI catalyst keeps telling me that the driver is not configured
not sure really, it was a couple of months ago
Oh, you've tried to run ATI's installer, right?
its installed and I configured xorg.conf for compiz
Does glxinfo or fglrxinfo tell you direct rendering is enabled? (in the terminal)
no it is not enabled =(
Well, given that you've already installed and configured the drivers, I don't know if this will work well for you, but the REAL way to install the ATI drivers is in the wiki.
care to point me to the wiki wiki?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BinaryDriverHowto/ATI -- It can be a pretty risky thing to do if you've already tried to install them before, but you can give it a shot.
I've actually been through almost all of that, I didn't see much difference
and fglrxinfo still gives you indirect rendering?
yes, not direct
Well, if nothing changes after a reboot, this might be a little difficult to troubleshoot. I can tell you from doing it myself that it does work pretty well from a clean install.
the weird thing is... I installed catalyst like 4 months ago and it worked fine, since then a plethora of upgrades and now it doesn't work, no new upgrades in about a week
Well, I'm guessing one or more of those upgrades changed Xorg or some of the open source drivers and now they're probably butting heads, 'ya know?
